page.title: 16WILDLIFE IN WARDOUR.
page.content: There are variety of different {habitats}in Wardour --- rivers, lakes, woodlands, meadows and hedgerows. These provide shelter for a lot of different{animals}and{birds.}The {mammals}include badger, foxes, deer, hares, rabbits, grey squirrels, a few otters and all common rodents. Most {common birds}(ie magpie, blue tits, great tits, black birds and thrush) are found in this area. There are also {birds of prey}--- kestrels, hawks and buzzards and{night birds}include owls and nightingales,. Many{water birds include heron, kingfisher, swan, ducks and geese. We have some{reptiles}in Wardour such as newts, frogs, toads, snakes, slow-worms. Farming machinery and{pesticides}have reduced the number of wild animals greatly but the {badgers}are thriving. {Stephen John
